general_provisions: This bill addresses a guardianship for an individual with a severe intellectual disability.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms for guardianship;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies court jurisdiction for guardianships;<hr><ltbullet>enacts a guardianship proceeding for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the applicability of a guardianship proceeding for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>enacts certain rights for an individual with a severe intellectual disability for which a full guardianship is imposed;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for a guardianship proceeding for an individual with a severe intellectual disability, including the requirements for the petition, venue, and in-person hearings;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the appointment of:<hr><ltbullet1>an attorney for a respondent in a guardianship proceeding for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet1>a physician, psychologist, physician assistant, or court visitor to examine the respondent; and<hr><ltbullet1>an emergency or temporary guardian while guardianship proceedings are pending;  <hr><ltbullet>provides that a court may appoint a guardian for a respondent if the court makes certain findings;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the court shall prefer a full guardianship for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>requires the court to include certain provisions in an order of appointment;<hr><ltbullet>provides who may be a guardian for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the duties, powers, and rights of a guardian for an individual with a severe intellectual disability in a full guardianship;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the removal or resignation of a guardian for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the termination of a guardianship for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a fee for a petition for guardianship is $35 if the prospective ward is the child, grandchild, or sibling of the petitioner; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
